title: Riot, nerf the items or the champion, don't completely destroy both
body:
Seriously, it's fucked up. {{champion:14}} {{champion:113}} both were strong with Cinderhulk (although the former was building it top lane), both received several nerfs and then Cinderhulk later got huge nerfs. And then it's such a knee jerk because in a few patches they go from absolute god tier 70% winrate to garbage.

Same thing happened with {{champion:19}} at the beginning of Season 5. Challenge smite + devourer made him OP, then Warwick got absolutely destroyed, and then you nerfed devourer for good measure. And now Warwick, even with Sated Bullshit, is still bad. 

For the love of god Riot, let the champion get played before item nerfs, or let them get played before actual champion nerfs, don't just rape both in the same patch, you don't want another {{champion:38}}, do you? You know, the guy who literally used to get nerfs every patch. And then got reworked to make him *even worse.* Are you trying to make Kassadin 2.0?

The problem is there are a ton of people who would have left that comment seriously.

I'd rather face Ekko than face Kayle to be honest. Kayle has a lot of sustained damage, shreds MR and Armor, and can save anyone's life. Sure, in a 1v5, Kayle can be CC'd, but in the middle of a team fight against a team that's trying to kill an ally or even focus you by blowing so really long CD's? You pop ult and you just stopped two or three all at once. Zed ult'ing your carry? Ult. LB about to jump your carry? Ult. Ekko trying to go in for that kill? Ult. Got a J4, Vi, and Yasuo all diving in for your fed as hell Vayne? Uuuuuuult.

Exactly. That´s what makes Kayle so incredibly easy to beat. She wastes ult on herself, it´s 3s of protection her now dead carry didn´t get. If she uses ult on her carry, well, that was a no cost ult flying out the window because Kayle's now dead which means her team can forget about that 15% armor and MR shred.

Comparing her kit to say, Yasuo's, Lee Sin's or even Ekko's kit, hers is a lot healthier and easier to run circles around.

I may not play in NA anymore cuz the server transfer banged up my ping, but in the BR server, Irelia and Kayle are the only champs i have level 5 mastery with. I don´t consider myself good with them or even their main, but i´m honestly surprised to see how much qq those two get. For no reason at all.

I know the Irelia meme.
Kayle just got her own with the 5 AD thing. Which, killed her jungling waaaaay before Devourer got nerfed on ranged. And crippled her laning.

Kayle's sustained damage only becomes really noticeable after she finishes Nashor's. Before, it´s like a no AP Karthus Q. Barely even tickles.

She's got a pretty painful early game (like, level 1-3), falls off hard midgame, and then starts inflicting real pain after three items or so. Once she has Nashor's and Wit's End you need to start being careful, because the MR shred on top of her passive starts to make for painful fighting.
If he gets a penta with that ult, you deserved it. There is nothing else to say here.
If Kayle chunks down your whole team while on ult, you deserved it too.

"Balance is a lie - we are the true ninjas."
― Zed

Well we all knew that the tank meta wouldn't last forever. I remember multiple threads thanking Riot for making it and how pretty much everyone except adc mains loved it. It was fun, but slicing off the top percentage is standard from patch to patch so the one item that made it so, cinderhulk, along with a couple champions got nerfed to the point where we reached our point of constant instability once more.
I'm an ADC main and I loved Cinderhulk.
That's a very selective memory.

Except those nerfs weren't out of line.

The nerfs to the items were because the items themselves were too powerful. Literally anyone that wanted health was taking Smite and picking up a Cinderhulk for the massive extra chunk of HP. Instead of being a niche thing that occasionally saw lane play, it was a minimum 2 Cinderhulks per team.

Sion and Sejuani also needed nerfs because, even after bringing Cinderhulk to a manageable level, they would still be ridiculously strong.

As for Warwick and Skirmisher's, that was imbalanced from the start. Instant on-hit true damage can't be balanced as long as on-hit stackers exist. Your guess is as good as mine, so far as why Warwick himself was nerfed, but I would guess that has to do with items as well.

Honestly I get downvoted whenever I talk about Sona around here, but at least I try to explain it a little bit more. Try that out, if people do not listen, oh well.

Parts of the problem with Sejuani is that she competes so much with Amumu
Either Amumu or Sejuani is almost always better then the other

As they pretty much fill the same role of a Tank with initiation and damage
And the one with the most damage of the two is often the strongest of the two

Part of that is the meta, and part of that is other options being too strong rather than Sejuani being too weak. Devourer is still insanely powerful, and offensive junglers are stronger at the moment.

>Devourer is still insanely powerful

Devourer's overrated. All three other enchants are stronger than it, Sej is just a weaker Cinderhulk user than guys like Grag, Rek'sai, Amumu and Shyvana.
It's not universally powerful, but for those that use it best, it's insane.

Personally I'm not a fan of giving up my early game. 

I'd prefer Warrior or Cinder on all of its users since the power gap isn't substantial and not having an early game is a terrible idea.
It's more preferential in that regard, really, and I can't just find fault in another player's rational decision based on their opinion.

I'm all for micro adjustments rather than a full reversion, tuning them back up in increments until they are in a place Riot and the players are both happy with is better than just letting them rot in the wilderness.

Sion is supposed to be a higher risk Juggernaut than Darius or Garen for a reason, yet his risk as it stands far outweighs the reward.

There's a good reason Garen is a solo queue god and Darius is everywhere even in competitive, they are both extremely safe and reliable picks where the risks are lower than the rewards. Sion is just far too risky a pick because R is too easily punished.

At least they learned not to nerf both.They could have easily nerfed the crap out of AP {{champion:81}} along with the whole {{item:3708}} mid fiasco.But instead they just nerfed Runeglaive & AP Ez made it out untouched.
